title: In Its Fifth Year, Citibank's Plant-a-Tree Program Surpasses 111,000 Trees Planted
summary: Budapest, Hungary - Citibank Hungary is planting another 59,000 trees around Budapest this autumn in the continuation of its Plant-a-Tree Program. When launching this program in 2008, Citibank promised to plant a tree for every customer switching from printed to paperless e-statements. Citibank's overall aim in this global initiative is to drive environmentally friendly behavior among its customers and to contribute to the conservation of forests in partnership with customers, non-governmental organizations and forestry companies.
tag-1: In Its Fifth Year, Citibank's Plant-a-Tree Program Surpasses 111,000 Trees Planted
tag-2: Budapest, Hungary – Citibank Hungary is planting another 59,000 trees around Budapest this autumn in the continuation of its Plant-a-Tree Program. When launching this program in 2008, Citibank promised to plant a tree for every customer switching from printed to paperless e-statements. Citibank's overall aim in this global initiative is to drive environmentally friendly behavior among its customers and to contribute to the conservation of forests in partnership with customers, non-governmental organizations and forestry companies.
tag-3: This fall, in the forests around Budapest, 59,000 saplings will be planted and managed by the Pilisi Parkerdo Forestry to replace trees lost in the aftermath of droughts in 2011 and 2012.
tag-4: Batara Sianturi, Citi Country Officer for Citibank Hungary, said: "We at Citibank are very pleased to see an increasing number of our customers getting engaged in this program and telling us how much they appreciate this initiative. We are celebrating the fifth anniversary of this program with a record number of trees to be planted in the name of our customers, marking a five-year total of 111,000 trees. This is a wonderful example of our contribution to the community and supports Citi's endeavor to become the world's leading digital bank."
tag-5: Jon Wiggins, Consumer Business Manager, remarked, "Along with the environmental benefits of preserving nature, going paperless has its consumer advantages as well, as we are providing our customers with a most advanced digital solution to view their statements and track their transactions online anywhere, anytime."
tag-6: "The Pilisi Parkerdo Forestry Company is delighted to work together with Citibank on this important project," said Peter Csepanyi, chief engineer responsible for production and environmental affairs at Pilisi Parkerdo Forestry. "I would like to thank Citibank for their continued support in saving the forests for the next generation. The trees that we are planting will help to clean the air we breathe, purify waterways, control erosion, add beauty to the landscape and provide food and habitat for wildlife."
tag-7: Citibank's partners in this project are the For Naszaly Foundation and the Pilisi Parkerdo Forestry. The Pilisi Parkerdo Forestry Company was established in 1969, and its specialists now manage 65,000 hectares of national forests in the area surrounding the capital, where the demand for healthy environment and the conservation of natural resources is enormous.
tag-8: To read more about Citibank Hungary's Plant-a-Tree Program please visit Citibank's website at www.citibank.hu.
